thread.title: Portland Metro Friday Traffic: MAX Green and Orange line delays; Crash I-5 south at Marine Drive
thread.title_full: Portland Metro Friday Traffic: MAX Green and Orange line delays; Crash I-5 south at Marine Drive | OregonLive.com

author: Rosemarie Stein | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Portland Metro Friday Traffic: MAX Green and Orange line delays; Crash I-5 south at Marine Drive
text:
Daily traffic » All traffic news » PDX Traffic Alerts on Twitter » Elliot Njus's Hard Drive blog » All weather news » School closures/delays
Cool temperatures this morning will have you looking for that warmer coat, possibly some gloves (especially if you're riding your bike to work/school) and a hat. Some areas west of Portland are reporting temperatures of 38-40 degrees. Burrrr at the bus stop.
CLACKAMAS 7:56 a.m.; Injury crash reported at Southeast 82nd Avenue and Otty Road.
***
TRIMET MAX 7:48 a.m.; After about 45 minutes of Twitter grumbling from riders, TriMet announces up to 15 minute delays on the Blue and Red lines due to a mechanical issue. UPDATE delays moved to Orange and Green lines. Maybe just expect delays...
***
OREGON CITY 7:14 a.m.; Incident on I-205 southbound near Stafford Road has traffic backing up into Oregon City.
***
UPDATE DELTA PARK 8:23 a.m.; Crash I-5 southbound at Marine Drive has the left and center lanes blocked. Could be a long delay coming out of Vancouver. ALL LANES CLEARED.
***
UPDATE EAST VANCOUVER 7:18 a.m.; Crash at I-205 southbound at the SR 500 interchange. Causing slowing. CLEARED.
***
UPDATE U.S. 26 EASTBOUND 7:55 a.m.; Stalled truck blocks the left lane near Camelot Court. ODOT with the truck. ALL CLEARED.
***
UPDATE TROUTDALE 6:40 a.m.; Rollover crash reported on Stark Street, just west of the Stark Street Bridge. CLOSED between Kerslake Street and the Stark Street Bridge for recovery.
***
Water pile construction continues in Lake Oswego and Durham Street between Ladd and Church streets. Road is closed 7 a.m.-6 p.m. today.
This is all part of a bigger project that has caused rolling street closures with detours in that area. During work hours, drivers can expect to see and hear heavy equipment and vehicles, dump trucks, and materials, such as pipe, steel plates and gravel. Work in the George Rogers Park area begins in November.
Also the Portland Bureau of Transportation lets us know that bus stop improvements will require a lane closures on Northeast Martin Luther King Jr. Boulevard at Holladay Street through Monday, October 26, all days, all hours.
The lane closures will allow crews to reinstall the bus stop pad in concrete.
There is still access to the businesses in the area and bus riders are asked to pick a stop before or after the construction area.
Check back throughout the morning for the latest commuting updates and follow us on Twitter: @trafficportland
#pdxtraffic Tweets The Oregonian
